importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: Doug Martin was selected 31st overall in the first round of the 2012 NFL draft, marking the beginning of his professional football career.
Martin achieved 1,402 rushing yards and six touchdowns in 2015, earning a Pro Bowl berth and first-team All-Pro honors.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: Doug Martin played professionally from 2012 to 2018, spanning six seasons with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers and one with the Oakland Raiders.

keyTakeAways: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back, died at the age of 36.
He was selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL Draft from Boise State.
Martin rushed for 5,356 yards and 30 touchdowns over his career.
He recorded 148 receptions for 1,207 yards and two touchdowns.
He earned a Pro Bowl berth in 2015 and was named first-team All-Pro.
The Tampa Bay Buccaneers recognized him as one of the top 50 players in franchise history during their 50th anniversary celebration.
The cause of death is currently unconfirmed and the family has asked for privacy.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Doug Martin, a former All-Pro running back with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, has died at the age of 36. Selected 31st overall in the 2012 NFL draft from Boise State, Martin had a standout career with 5,356 rushing yards and 30 touchdowns, including a Pro Bowl and first-team All-Pro season in 2015. He also had 148 catches for 1,207 yards. The Buccaneers, which he played for for six seasons and one with the Raiders, expressed deep sorrow over his passing, and recognized him as one of the top 50 players in franchise history during the team's 50th anniversary celebration. The cause of death remains unconfirmed.
title: Doug Martin, Former Tampa Bay Buccaneers Star, Dies at 36
